definition: delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
slow/unhurried/sluggish/gradual/not tense/relaxed/to postpone/to defer/to stall/to stave off/to revive/to recuperate
soldiers/a force/an army/weapons/arms/military/warlike/CL:個|个[ge4]
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
surname Ji
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge

sentences.english: What he said is just to delay the time.
sentences.chinese: 他的托词只是缓兵之计。

sentences.english: Most observers agree that temporary foreign teachers are not a permanent solution.
sentences.chinese: 许多专家认为聘请外籍教师的办法只是一个缓兵之计。
他的托辞只是缓兵之计。

sentences.english: You are slow-walking me, aren't you?
sentences.chinese: 这不过是你的缓兵之计吧？

delaying tactics/deliberate procrastination
